title: Bug 7734: System can be shut down without save file warnings
description: When shutting down Windows, WSWB does not provide a warning or prompt to save any unsaved changes in open, dirty .txt files. This can result in the loss of changes made to the .txt files.
OB: When a WSWB session is open with at least one open and dirty .txt file, and Windows is shut down without saving, the changes made to the dirty .txt file(s) are lost.
EB: When a WSWB session is open with at least one open and dirty .txt file, and Windows is shut down without saving, a warning or prompt should be displayed to give users an opportunity to save their changes before proceeding with the shutdown.
SR:
1. Open WSWB and create a new project
2. Create a text file in the project
3. Add a line of text to the text file
4. Notice that the text file is marked as dirty (unsaved)
5. Left-click on the Windows Start menu
6. Select the 'Shut Down' command to shut down/reboot the computer

Expected Result: A warning or prompt message should be displayed to give users a chance to save their dirty model(s) before the computer is shut down/rebooted.
